BMZ/CARE.name: Strengthening WASH basic infrastructure, resilience and livelihoods in return areas in Ninewa, Iraq
BMZ/CARE.summary: Enhance the resilience of vulnerable host communities and sustainable reintegration of conflict affected returnees in Sinjar and Zummar. targeting individual’s vulnerable and conflict-affected households.
obj: Improved access to water for vulnerable host families and returnees with equal access for men, women, girls, and boys
Improved awareness on safe hygiene and sanitation practices
Improved opportunities for culturally and gender sensitive livelihoods for vulnerable families returning home
Improved access to food for COVID-19 affected families.

UNOCHA/WVI.name: Provision of immediate life-saving assistance, agricultural assets/inputs and improved livelihoods for income generation for vulnerable IDPs, Returnees and Host communities in Ninewa Governorate
UNOCHA/WVI.summary: Supporting severely vulnerable IDPs (non-camp), returnees and Host Community in Al Mosul, Sinjar and Tilkaif districts through distribution of agricultural assets and inputs to (re)start their livelihoods.
obj:
improving the status of food security through support with agricultural
livelihoods for increased access and availability of food at household level as well as generate agricultural income of food insecure IDPs,
Returnees and Host Communities.

BMZ/ASB.name: Strengthening the resilience of conflict-affected residents and returnees in newly accessible areas through improving food security, livelihoods and solidarity
BMZ/ASB.summary: Providing livelihood services like food security and social cohesion in the areas of the Sinjar and Telafar districts in Nineveh Governorate of Iraq.
obj:
Food security 
With irrigated agricultural production restored and increased in selected communities of Sinjar and Telafar districts, access to nutritious food is improved and livelihood can be independently secured.

Income-generation
Resident and returnee farmers living in Sinjar and Telafar districts are provided with skills to sustainable income generation through increase of on farm income and thus local economy strengthened.

Social cohesion
Resident and returnee villagers and communities supported to promote peaceful coexistence and strengthen social cohesion to ensure that all have equal access to irrigated agricultural production inputs and outputs.

UNOCHA/Dorcas.name: Creating an enabling environment for sustainable livelihoods of vulnerable households in Sinjar and Telkaif District through the provision of protection and agricultural services.
UNOCHA/Dorcas.summary: Expanding General Protection services to areas with high needs in order to ensure safe and dignified returns and sustainable lives of people in Sinjar districts.
obj: Provide specialized protection assistance, and community-based support, to vulnerable conflict-affected individuals, thereby enabling them to secure their rights, access humanitarian assistance and public services, and overcome barriers to achievement of durable solutions.

UNICEF.name: Providing PSS, case managment and vocational training services for women and girls
UNICEF.summary: Fulfill gaps in addressing GBV against women  through setting up safe space for women and girls , awareness, case management, providing PSSl support a and capacity building of services providers.
obj:
Improve women’s and children’s
access to lifesaving GBV services 
and reduce risks of GBV through 
improved multi-sectoral and 
community-based protection.

UNICEF2.name: Provision of Gender-Based Violence prevention and response services for women and girls in Ninawa and west Mosul
UNICEF2.summary: provision of GBV case management and Structured PSS programme,using structured programme specifically designed for adolescent girls,skills building through vocational training for women and girls
obj:
Improve women’s and children’s
access to lifesaving GBV services 
and reduce risks of GBV through 
improved multi-sectoral and 
community-based protection.

UNHCR.name: Protection and Assistance programme for Refugees and IDPs in Duhok-Iraq
UNHCR.summary: Legal aid, protection monitoring and counselling and other subsequent response for refugees, asylum seekers, and IDPs and S/GBV support services for refugees and asylum seekers.
obj: Access to legal assistance and legal remedies improved (Refugees and IDPs)
Quality of registration and profiling to be improved or maintained (Refugees and IDPs)
Risk of SGBV is reduced and quality of response improved (Refugees)
Civil registration and civil status documentation strengthened (IDPs)

UNFPA.name: UNFPA Country Programe for Iraq 2020-2024
UNFPA.summary: Providing GBV,  Youth and RH services in Duhok and Nineveh. With 15 women centers operating across Dohuk and Ninewe governorates providing different services to vulnerable women and girls.
obj: Strengthened capacity of government and civil society institutions to mitigate and respond to gender-based violence and harmful practices, with a special focus on vulnerable women in humanitarian settings. (GBV)

Enhanced capacity of national government and civil society organizations to design and implement programmes on reproductive health, social cohesion and civic engagement for vulnerable young people, with special focus on marginalized adolescent girls in humanitarian settings (Youth Programme)

Increased capacity of Ministry of Health, and civil society organizations to deliver integrated quality reproductive health services that meet the needs of vulnerable populations, especially those in humanitarian settings (Health Cluster)

IHF3/Dorcas.name:
Strengthening Protection, 
HLP Response,and Prevention 
services during COVI9-19 
Pandemic in Duhok, Ninewa 
governorates in Iraq.
IHF3/Dorcas.summary: Provision of Cash For Protection, Psychosocial Support, Case Managment for IDP's and Returnees across through Duhok and Nineveh
obj:
The overall objective of the project is Strengthening Protection and HLP Response and Prevention services during
COVI9-19 Pandemic in Duhok, Ninewa governorates in Iraq

GAC/CARE.name: WASH, Protection and SRHR support to IDPs and Returnees in Iraq 2020-2021
GAC/CARE.summary: provision of water, rehabilitation/construction of water networks, C&M of WASH facilities, waste management, hygiene kits distribution, and hygiene promotion using PHAST for IDPs and Returnees.
obj: Water infrastructure repaired, maintained, or rehabilitated in IDP camps and Sinjar
Sanitation infrastructure in IDP camps and Sinjar maintained and/or repaired
Hygiene promotion undertaken in IDP camps and Sinjar
Garbage collection and desludging undertaken in IDP camps and authorities supported for ownership
Gender-sensitive hygiene items distributed to returnees in Sinjar

IHF-UNOCHA.name: National Consortium
IHF-UNOCHA.summary: Providing sexual and reproductive health services in eleven IDPs camps through its RH Clinics, in addtion supporting three maternity Hospital in Dohok, Zakho, Amadia .
obj: Increased capacity of Ministry of Health, and civil society organizations to deliver integrated quality reproductive health services that meet the needs of vulnerable populations, especially those in humanitarian settings (Health Cluster)
